Long after the war Germany ignored its past and the school children were not taught about the Nazis. People like Sophie and Staffenburg were regarded as traitors. When I visited Germany recently and in 2006 I found very little public  evidence of The White rose group. Quietly, Germany is removing evidence of the atrocities of WW2 in the same way the post war chancellor drew a line on prosecutions after the Nuremberg trials.it was the Nazis party that drove the War and the atrocities but the German people were very much behind them and their policies.Words cannot express how brave Sophie and a few others were to openly resist.

answers.text: @w14woman nice to hear it. I also visited the gestapo museum in Vienna. The signposting was very small. Also in Bremerhaven they have named a street after recognising a U boat captain who was executed for speaking out against the nazi regime.

@dkw1948 However when we visited in 2014, there was much then in evidence both in Munich and at the university. Perhaps some level of slow revisiting?  The White Rose Group including Sophie were brave and utterly courageous.
